intro: Talinum palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's spinach, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features upright stems with palmate leaves that are edible and have a mild, spinach-like flavor. It produces showy, pink to red flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Talinum palmeri thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along stream banks.
